meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unpleasant in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The uglinesses of the old building made it hard to look at.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't ignore the uglinesses of the graffiti on the wall.
meanings.sent3: Despite the uglinesses of the situation, they found humor in it.
meanings.sent4: The uglinesses of the city's neglect were like a dark cloud hanging over it.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the uglinesses of poverty in his painting.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being morally offensive or objectionable.
meanings.sent1: The uglinesses of the crime shocked the community.
meanings.sent2: They were appalled by the uglinesses of the corrupt politician's actions.
meanings.sent3: The movie portrayed the uglinesses of greed in a lighthearted way.
meanings.sent4: The uglinesses of betrayal cut deep into their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The uglinesses of discrimination were evident in the unequal treatment.
